sen.e: Fuguruma-yobi is a Japanese apparition which appears in "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro", a collection of paintings of apparition drawn by Sekien TORIYAMA.

sen.e: Fuguruma means a box cart which was used at the imperial palace or temples for carrying books in the event of emergency like an accidental fire.

sen.j: 『徒然草』第72段に「多くて見苦しからぬは、文車の文、塵塚の塵」という一文があり、この「文車の文」から文車妖妃、「塵塚の塵」から塵塚怪王が創作されたとの説もある。
sen.e: As a sentence " fuguruma no fumi (文車の文 : books on a book cart) and chirizuka no chiri (塵塚の塵 : the rubbish at dust heap) are not unsightly even though there are many or there is much" is seen in the chapter 72 of "Tsurezuregusa", some people say that fuguruma-yobi (文車妖妃) and chirizuka-kaio (塵塚怪王) were created based on the above-mentioned "文車の文" and "塵塚の塵 " respectively.
